intro: Rubus laetus, commonly known as the evergreen blackberry, is a shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, dark purple to black berries that are edible and have a tart flavor. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and along streambanks. The botanical features of Rubus laetus make it a valuable plant for both ecological and culinary purposes.
